Draft Rating:

B

Kevin McHale ranks in the 72th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. McHale's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 4 spots higher than they were picked due to his good drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Kevin Garnett with 5th pick but was worth 1th pick.
  • Drafted Jerome Allen with 49th pick but was worth 26th pick.
  • Drafted Mark Davis with 48th pick but was worth 34th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Wally Szczerbiak with 6th pick but was worth 11th pick.
  • Drafted Corey Brewer with 7th pick but was worth 45th pick.
  • Drafted Rasho Nesterović with 17th pick but was worth 46th pick.

Trade Rating:

D-

Kevin McHale ranks in the 21th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Brian Cardinal, Jason Collins, Kevin Love, Mike Miller to MIN.
  • Lost Greg Buckner, Marko Jarić, O.J. Mayo, Antoine Walker to MEM.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Ryan Gomes, Gerald Green, Al Jefferson, Theo Ratliff, Sebastian Telfair, Wayne Ellington, Jonny Flynn to MIN.
  • Lost Kevin Garnett to BOS.

Signing Rating:

D-

Kevin McHale ranks in the 26th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Fred Hoiberg in 2003.
  • Signed Chauncey Billups in 2000.
  • Signed Terry Porter in 1995.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Sam Mitchell in 1995.
  • Signed Trenton Hassell in 2003.
  • Signed Mark Madsen in 2003.
